greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of standard Young tableaux for partitions of n into exactly k distinct parts; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=A003056(n), read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0. The triangle contains only the terms with k<=A003056(n). T(n,k) = 0 for k>A003056(n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..100, flattened
maple: h:= proc(l) local n; n:=nops(l); add(i, i=l)!/mul(mul(1+l[i]-j+
A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(k<0, 0, g(n, n, k, [])) end:
mathematica: h[l_] := With[{n = Length[l]}, Sum[i, {i, l}]! / Product[Product[1 + l[[i]] - j + Sum[If[l[[k]] >= j, 1, 0], {k, i+1, n}], {j, 1, l[[i]]}], {i, 1, n}] ]; g[n_, i_, k_, l_] := If[n == 0, h[l], If[n > k*(i-(k-1)/2), 0, g[n, i-1, Min[k, i-1], l] + If[i > n, 0, g[n-i, i-1, k-1, Append[l, i]]]] ]; a[n_, k_] := a[n, k] = If[k < 0, 0, g[n, n, k, {}] ]; t[n_, k_] := a[n, k] - a[n, k-1]; Table[Table[t[n, k], {k, 0, Floor[(Sqrt[1+8*n]-1)/2]}], {n, 0, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 17 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 17 2012
